revisions.rev:
{{NBA season | team = Portland Trail Blazers | logo = PortlandTrailBlazersMainLogo.svg | imagesize = 200px | end_year = 2010 | wins = 50 | losses = 32 | division = Northwest | division_place = 3rd | conf_place = 6th | coach = [[Nate McMillan]] | arena = [[Rose Garden (arena)|Rose Garden]] | television = [[CSN Northwest]], [[KGW]] | radio = [[KXTG]] | playoffs = [[2010 NBA Playoffs|Lost in first round to Phoenix 4-2]] | bbr_team = POR }} The '''[[2009â10 NBA season|2009â10]] [[Portland Trail Blazers]] season''' was 40th season of the franchise in the [[National Basketball Association]] (NBA). ==Key dates== *'''June 25''' - The [[2009 NBA Draft]] took place in [[New York City]]. *'''July 8''' - The [[free agent|free agency]] period started. * '''September 28''' - Training camp begins * '''October 6''' - First preseason game * '''October 14''' - Commemorative 40-year anniversary game at [[Memorial Coliseum (Portland)|Memorial Coliseum]] * '''October 27''' - First regular-season game * '''March 16''' - [[Tom Penn]] is relieved of his assistant general manager duties by owner [[Paul Allen]]. * '''April 18''' - Blazers begin playoff series with the [[Phoenix Suns]]. * '''April 29''' - [[Phoenix Suns]] defeat the Blazers in Game 6 of the playoff series. * '''June 24, 2010''' - [[Kevin Pritchard]] is relieved of his general manager duties by owner [[Paul Allen]]. ==Offseason== ===Draft picks=== {{main|2009 NBA Draft}} {| class="wikitable" |- ! Round ! Pick ! ({{college|UNLV}}) | ath_train = *{{player||USA|Jay Jensen}} ({{college|Loma Linda}}) *{{player||USA|Geoff Clark}} ({{college|Oregon State}}) }} ==Pre-season== As part of the team's 40th-year celebration, the Blazers played a pre-season game at [[Memorial Coliseum (Portland)|Memorial Coliseum]] on October 14, 2009 against the [[Phoenix Suns]]. Team founder [[Harry Glickman]], former players [[Jerome Kersey]], [[Terry Porter]], and [[Bob Gross]], as well as broadcaster [[Bill Schonely]] attended the game. The Suns defeated the Blazers, 110-104 with 11,740 tickets sold.{{cite news |title=Blazers go retro but lose 110-104 to Suns |author=Anne M. Peterson |newspaper=Yahoo! Sports |date=2009-10-15 |url=http://sports.yahoo.com/nba/recap;_ylt=AqF0UHsUUigetSrzkYQyLbC8vLYF?gid=2009101422 }} All tickets for this game were $19.70 to represent the team's inaugural 1970 season.http://www.nba.com/blazers/news/cheers_40_years_announcement_2009_08_17.html {| class="toccolours collapsible" width=90% style="clear:both; margin:1.5em auto; text-align:center" |- ! colspan=11 [[Brandon Roy]] was named ''[[Western Conference (NBA)|Western Conference]] Player of the Week'' for games played March 8âMarch 14.http://www.nba.com/2010/news/03/15/players.week/index.html ====All-Star==== * [[Brandon Roy]] was selected as an All-Star reserve (third All-Star appearance; did not play due to injury). ====Season==== {{Empty section|date=January 2011}} ===Records=== {{Empty section|date=January 2011}} ===Milestones=== {{Empty section|date=January 2011}} ==Injuries and surgeries== * July 9: [[Patrick Mills]] - broken foot; returned to active roster January 4{{cite news|url=http://blog.oregonlive.com/behindblazersbeat/2009/12/blazers_injuries_ailments_cont.html|title=Blazers' injuries, ailments continue to pile up|work=[[The Oregonian]]|date=December 8, 2009|accessdate=February 17, 2010}} * September 9: [[Jeff Pendergraph]] - surgery to repair congenital hip disorder; returned to active roster December 21 * October 30: [[Nicolas Batum]] - surgery to repair right shoulder muscle tear; returned to active roster January 25 * November 14: [[Travis Outlaw]] - broken left foot; traded February 16 * December 5: [[Greg Oden]] - broken left patella; out for season * December 5: Coach [[Nate McMillan]] - ruptured right [[Achilles tendon]]; returned to the bench December 15 * December 8: [[Rudy FernÃ¡ndez (basketball)|Rudy FernÃ¡ndez]] - surgery to repair sciatic nerve damage; returned to active roster January 13 * December 22: [[Joel Przybilla]] - dislocated right patella and ruptured patellar tendon; out for season{{cite web|url=http://sports.espn.go.com/nba/news/story?id=4771214|title=Trail Blazers center Joel Przybilla out for season after surgery|accessdate=February 17, 2010|Associated Press |date=December 24, 2009 |publisher=ESPN.com}} * January 2: [[Brandon Roy]] - strained hamstring; returned to active roster February 16{{cite news|url=http://blog.oregonlive.com/behindblazersbeat/2010/02/brandon_roy_says_he_will_try_t.html|title=Blazers' Brandon Roy says he will try to play Friday against Boston Celtics|last=Quick|first=Jason|date=February 17, 2010|accessdate=February 17, 2010|work=[[The Oregonian]]}} * April 11: [[Brandon Roy]] - right knee [[Tear of meniscus|meniscus tear]], arthroscopic knee surgery; returned to active roster April 24{{cite web|url=http://scores.espn.go.com/nba/recap?gameId=300424022|title=Roy returns to help Blazers blister Suns and even series|accessdate=April 24,
